Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is thickly encrusted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394588) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394588)
